title.narrative: In-Country Counternarcotics Program

description.narrative: In-Country Counternarcotics Program under U.S. Northern Command. The U.S. Department of Defense International Counter-Drug Program (ICDP) enables the Secretary of Defense to provide foreign governments with support, such as training and equipment, to combat illicit drug trafficking and transnational organized crime.

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - CDA, CDO, CDSOF

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: Global Train and Equip Program - Special Operations Forces Training

description.narrative: To conduct or support programs providing training and equipment to national security forces of foreign countries for the purpose of building capacity of partner nations. The Defense Security Cooperation Agency (DSCA) provides program management. Country teams work through DoD geographic Combatant Commands (COCOMs).

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Counternarcotics and Global Threats: Mexico - Domain Awareness (Air)

description.narrative: The Office of the Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Counternarcotics and Global Threats develops DoD counterdrug (CD) and counter-transnational organized crime (CTOC) policy. It also issues guidance, establishes priorities, and oversees resource allocation and program execution, for DoD CD and CTOC missions. These missions focus on countering illicit drug trafficking, but also include countering illicit financial flows and the illicit trafficking of people, wildlife, natural resources, and weapons. Primary activities include: coordinate and monitor DoD and interagency efforts for the detection and monitoring of the maritime and aerial transit of illegal drugs into the United States; direct, oversee, and monitor planning, programming, and budget (formulation, justification, and execution) processes for DoD Drug Interdiction and CD Activities programs, in coordination with other DoD Components; review, evaluate, coordinate, and monitor DoD CD and CTOC plans and programs to ensure adherence to approved policy and standards.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide
Department of Defense, Operation and Maintenance, Defense-Wide

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Mexico - Logistics Modernization Initiative #1. Establish a concept of logistics operation that supports SEMARs vision and desired end state of a modernized logistics enterprise in the future;Support SEMAR and ODC-MX initiatives with respect to Supply Chain Management, Maintenance Management and Standard Operating Procedures development; Build and implement a modernization road map with appropriate initiatives, timelines, milestones and objectives including provision for periodic progress reviews.

title.narrative: U.S. Department of Defense, Institutional Capacity Building Programs: Defense Institution Reform Initiative

description.narrative: Mexico - Logistics Modernization Initiative #2. Support SEMARs major goals to create and manage a logistics modernization project that would move the organization from a paper-based, analogue logistics system to an automated one with professionally trained and educated personnel using standardized logistics processes and procedures.
